other_tests.findings: A novel c.979-96 T>A mutation in the SGK3 gene was found to be strictly segregated with patients in a heterozygous pattern and was not present in normal family members. This mutation caused exon 13 skipping and in-frame deletion of 29 amino acids in the protein kinase domain.
No copy number variation was observed in the genome.
PHEX and FGF23 mutations were not detected; mutations in DMP1, ENPP1, CLCN5, SLC9A3R1, SLC34A1 or SLC34A3 were also not found.
Revealed scoliosis and degeneration at intervertebral discs, milkman fractures at femur necks.
